item.title: Online Slideshow
item.description: Simply git-push your presentation content - markdown and assets - to any branch within a public repository on GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket and GitPitch and find your slideshow instantly available online at the following URL: Substitute your GitHub account name, repository, and branch for $user, $repo, and $branch respectively. For GitLab and Bitbucket users, see the slideshow presentation URLs docs for further details. item.title: Offline Slideshow
item.description: GitPitch Desktop Offline Support One-Click Offline Slideshow Download GitPitch Desktop Offline Support If you plan on working offline we recommend downloading the GitPitch Docs too. To download the docs bundle, click here. Then expand the zip bundle and open index.html under a local Web server. GitPitch Pro + Lite subscriptions unlock numerous features including GitPitch Desktop - a dedicated presentation tool that lets you develop, preview, and present GitPitch slideshows directly on your Linux, Windows, or OSX desktop.

item.title: PDF Slideshow
item.description:
Offline Printing GitPitch subscribers enjoy GitPitch Desktop. It’s a dedicated desktop presentation tool that let’s you develop, preview, and present slide decks offline. Within the Desktop press the D key on your keyboard when viewing any slide deck to open the Desktop Document Generator. With one click you can then export your slide deck as a PDF document.
Your PDF document is a highly portable document that can be shared absolutely anywhere.

item.title: PPTX Slideshow
item.description:
Export to Microsoft PowerPoint, Apple Keynote, and Google Slides GitPitch subscribers enjoy GitPitch Desktop. It’s a dedicated desktop presentation tool that let’s you develop, preview, and present slide decks offline. Within the Desktop press the D key on your keyboard when viewing any slide deck to open the Desktop Document Generator. With one click you can then export your slide deck as a PPTX document.
Your PPTX document is a highly portable document that can be open directly within Microsoft PowerPoint and Apple Keynote on your desktop.

item.title: Theme Switcher
item.description: GitPitch ships with a set of distinct slideshow themes out-of-the-box. Each theme offers it’s own unique look-and-feel for your slideshow content. Themes vary font styles, spacing, colors, backgrounds, etc. You can use the Theme Switching panel found under the slideshow menu to try out the different themes. Simply select any theme shown in the switching panel and your presentation will be instantly rendered using a new look-and-feel. One you find a theme that you like you can activate it as the fixed theme for your presentation using the theme setting in your PITCHME.

item.title: Keyboard Controls
item.description: GitPitch slideshow presentations offer numerous keyboard controls and shortcuts to help presentation authors and their audiences to navigate and interact with slideshow content. Live presentation speakers should take special note of the following slideshow modes: Press F for Fullscreen Mode Press O for Overview Mode Press B for Blackout Mode Press the ? key when viewing any slideshow presentation to view the following keyboard shortcuts table: Beyond keyboard navigations, GitPitch also supports mouse-wheel navigation and remote-control navigation.
